Definition: one  of  the  early  operations  in  the  cleaning  of  flax  fiber.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: one  of  the  later  stages  of  yarn  manufacture  as  the  yarn is  being  drawn  out  for  spinning.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: a  process  whereby  a  beautiful  luster  is  given to  cloth  by  the  use  of  etched  rollers.  this  luster  will  not  survive laundering.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: the  first  cleaning  of  flax  fiber  after  the  breaking process.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: removal  of  the  seams  and  other  stitched  parts  in  ma terials  that  are  to  be  garnetted.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: materials  containing  imperfections.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: making  colors  permanent,  or  fast.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: a  term  used  in  weaving  to  describe  the  opening  in  the warp  yarns  for  one  passage  of  the  shuttle.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: a  common  name  for  all  reclaimed  wool.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: one  of  the  several  yarns  which  are  twisted  together  to make  thread  or  a  coarser  yarn.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: stiffened  or  starched.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: the  removal  of  the  tag  ends  and  torn  edges  from  a  fleece.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: one  of  the  ropelike  stages  into  which  yarn  is  drawn  in  the process  of  manufacture.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: a  stage  in  the  manufacture  of  yarn  before  it  is  drawn into  roving.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: silk  material  from  which  only  a  part  of  the  gum  has been  removed.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: the  two  holes  in  the  head  of  the  silkworm  through which  he  ejects  the  silk  fiber.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: the  machine,  used  in  linen  manufacture,  on  which the  dressed  flax  is  placed,  or  spread,  for  the  first  drawing  process.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: silk  or  silk  materials  made  from  pierced  cocoons,  and all  other  forms  of  waste  silk  which  cannot  be  reeled  but  must  be spun  into  yarns.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: yarn  made  from  the  short  and  broken  fibers  in  the manufacture  of  rayon.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: a  term  used  for  fibers  when  measured  in  a  mass.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: rayon  fibers  cut  into  uniform  lengths  of  a  few inches.  used  for  spun  rayon  or  to  mix  with  other  fibers.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: materials  so  useful  as  to  have  become  a  perma nent  necessity.  examples :  crash,  broadcloth,  percale.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: the  dyeing  of  the  fiber,  or  stock.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: a  term  used  in  the  manufacture  of  rayon  when fine  filaments  are  made  by  stretching  larger  filaments  in  the  coagu lating  bath.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: a  chemically  made  fiber.  rayon.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: the  dirty,  stained  portions  around  the  edges  of  a  fleece.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: a  mill  expression  the  same  as  weaken  when  used  in  con nection  with  the  injurious  effect  of  poor  bleaching.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: the  stretching  of  cloth  to  width  in  a  tenter  frame.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: the  doubling  and  twisting  of  reeled  silk  into  yarn.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: in  silk  manufacture  the  operatives  who  do  the  throw ing  are  called  throwsters. tie  dyed ,  or  tied  and  dyed.  see  tie  dyeing.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: producing  a  pattern  by  winding  string  around  certain parts  of  the  cloth  before  it  is  dyed.  the  string  prevents  the  dye  from acting  on  those  spots,  which  remain  their  original  color.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: a  general  name  among  loggers  and  lumbermen  for trousers  so  treated  with  a  paraffin  preparation  as  to  be  hard,  stiff,  and impervious  to  water.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: a  process,  in  dyeing,  in  which  a  dyed  material  is  dipped into  a  bath  of  a  different  color.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: the  large,  soft  balls  of  combed  wool  fiber.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: the  short,  tangled  flax  fibers  that  are  combed  out  in  the dressing  process.  see  line.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: yarn  used  for  the  filling  in  silk  weaving.  it  is  usually coarser  and  has  less  twist  than  the  organzine,  or  warp.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: a  mill  and  trade  term  for  the  one-and-one  rib stitch  in  knitting.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: a  term  applied  to  yarn  or  thread  in  which  two  strands, or  singles,  are  twisted  together.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: wool  that  has  never  before  been  manufactured.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: the  up-and-down  lines  in  knitted  materials  formed  by  the sides  of  the  stitches.  see  courses.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: the  yarns  in  woven  cloth  running  lengthwise  of  the  piece.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: a  small  magnifying  glass  used  for  a  close  exami nation  of  cloth  or  yarn.  also  called  cloth  glass,  pick  glass,  linen glass,  linen  tester,  cloth  tester,  etc.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: the  weight  at  the  bottom  of  a  hand  spindle.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: silk  made  by  worms  that  cannot  be  domesticated.  many of  the  rough  silks,  like  pongee  and  shantung,  are  made  from  this fiber.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles

Definition: garments  that  are  made  of  flat  pieces wrought  or  knitted  to  shape.  full-fashioned  hose  are  made  of  such pieces.
Author: Small, Cassie Paine
Title: How to Know Textiles
